channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Volunteers foster literacy by reading to children and giving them books
item.description: Volunteers with the LiTEArary society read to children who live in "book deserts" and bring them their own books.

item.title: Fight over government layoffs continues as shutdown drags on
item.description: A federal judge in San Francisco will consider whether to indefinitely halt the thousands of layoffs of federal employees announced by the Trump admin...

item.title: As Trump talks of designating antifa a foreign terrorist group, experts see danger
item.description: The designation would have, as one domestic terrorism expert told NPR, a "cascading effect across civil society, including social media organizations,...

item.title: Louisiana officials waited months to warn public of whooping cough outbreak
item.description: After a whooping cough outbreak killed two infants, Louisiana health officials waited months to officially alert physicians or do public outreach. Tha...

item.title: America's immigration crackdown is disrupting the global remittance market
item.description: America's immigration crackdown might have serious financial consequences for a range of countries.

item.title: Tourist plane crash in Kenya kills 11 on board
item.description: Ten Europeans and a local pilot have died after the plane crashed while flying to a game park.

item.title: Man falls from stands at PPG Paints Arena during Penguins-Blues game
item.description: A fan suffered life-threatening injuries when he fell from the stands at PPG Paints Arena during a game between the Pittsburgh Penguins and St. Louis ...

item.title: Man pleads guilty to Japan ex-prime minister's murder: "Everything is true"
item.description: "There is no doubt that I have done all this," Tetsuya Yamagami said in court, admitting to the murder of the country's longest-serving leader in 2022...

item.title: Hurricane Melissa could be Jamaica's "storm of the century," forecasters say
item.description: Hurricane Melissa was set to pummel Jamaica as a catastrophic Category 5 storm, its strongest on record. It could be the island's "storm of the centur...

item.title: 9/23: CBS Morning News
item.description: Trump administration links Tylenol use in pregnancy to autism; NASA introduces new class of astronaut candidates.

item.title: Food banks are preparing for a surge as federal food aid could be paused in the government shutdown
item.description: Food banks and pantries are preparing for a surge in demand if federal food aid is paused this weekend from the government shutdown.

item.title: Israel says coffin from Hamas did not contain another hostage's body
item.description: Israel accuses Hamas of a "clear violation" of the Gaza ceasefire deal and says officials are discussing "steps in response".

item.title: Rare earths, Nobel nomination and cheers: Trump ends Japan leg of Asia tour
item.description: The red carpet was rolled out for Trump by Japan's Sanae Takaichi, who has only been prime minister since last week.

item.title: Maps show Hurricane Melissa approaching Jamaica as a Category 5
item.description: Hurricane Melissa, a fierce Category 5 storm, is expected to bring "catastrophic winds, flash flooding, and storm surge" to Jamaica Tuesday, forecaste...

Border Patrol official Bovino due in court to answer questions about Chicago immigration crackdown
Man pleads guilty to killing Japan's former PM Shinzo Abe
item.description: Tetsuya Yamagami, 45, shot Abe multiple times as he appeared at a political event in 2022.

item.title: Sudan's army loses key city of el-Fasher to paramilitary RSF after 18-month siege
item.description: The UN has raised the alarm over reports of "atrocities" committed by the RSF.
